website_summaries.verdict: Like 2 gifts in one: a fun puzzle with a solution that reveals cash. Comes with steps to the solution for those who need a little help.
pros: This is a unique brainteaser that conceals cash and other valuables in hidden compartments and requires figuring out the solution to access it
Makes a fun way to give cash gifts
cons: Too challenging for young children – not recommended for kids under 13 years

customer_reviews.title: Frustratingly Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Because my son, who is in his 30's, only wanted cash for Christmas, I decided I had to make it a little challenging. This was perfect! He got kind of frustrated and would set it down then try again in a bit and did so until he finally got to the treasure inside! Then the fun went on with everyone else having a try at it. And yes, I had to cheat and read the instructions so I could get the money in there! This is a well made product and is perfect for keeping out on a table for a conversation piece to challenge all guests!
customer_reviews.author: GmaDebi

customer_reviews.title: Great birthday present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew’s birthday. I figured since he loves Minecraft why not give him a real life puzzle with a prize inside (I put $10 inside but didn’t tell him.) I took the instructions page away from the box to make it more difficult. After 40 minutes he asked for help so I gave him the first step. He had it open within 2 minutes after that. He liked the money better than the box...but then realized his little sister or parents couldn’t open the box and it dissappeared into his room. Who knows what’s in it now!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good idea for money/gift cards
customer_reviews.text: Every year I buy a puzzle box/maze cube etc for my adult children just to make them work for their Christmas present. I must say, this is one of the finer ones. Even with the directions, I had a hard time figuring it out but I did. It is well constructed. The only thing I do not like is the kids can not see what is inside but I knew that upon ordering and they already know there will be something good inside! I would def recommend this product. I can't wait till Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: good gift for kids that like puzzles
customer_reviews.text: This was a christmas present for my 11 year old, He loves puzzles. I figured out how to open it and took out the instructions and filled it with change so he knew something was in it, I let him struggle for about 20 minutes before I told him the first step, and it took about 5 minutes after that for him to solve. Only problem was it was stuck at first , I couldn't budge it, my husband had to do it, but once we got it moving, it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: AngMarie28

customer_reviews.title: MEMH..
customer_reviews.text: Just a step above balsa wood. Poor construction. Laminated piece on top broke within the first 24 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Sloppy Deuce

customer_reviews.title: Well crafted
customer_reviews.text: I have most of the hard Hanayama puzzles and I struggle to find cool new puzzles that are well put together. This fits both of those bills. It's pretty simple, maybe a 2 or 3 minute puzzle at best, but it's a really satisfying mechanism and it's well put together. I have a much more challenging puzzle box, but it's not as creative as the mechanism in this. Put a difficult puzzle in the box, and give it to a friend for a good laugh. : d Has a nice handmade feel to it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mullins

customer_reviews.title: It's neat for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift and for the beginner it was neat enough. It had enough moves that were somewhat predictable, but it'll keep your attention. It was also nice that it had slots in for you to insert cash/coins in to add to if you were giving it as a gift. The box was built extremely light though, so I wouldn't give it a really long life expectancy. There was instructions included in the box on how to open it, so if you are giving it as a gift, you might want to take them out beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift Idea
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and a very interesting path to getting to your gift. Every year I give a "money puzzle" to my 6 grandchildren and they always have such a great time trying to figure it out!!
customer_reviews.author: Gram

customer_reviews.title: Precision made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one a while back. It was so well made and precise and I bought 5 more for gifts.
customer_reviews.author: De box De box!

customer_reviews.title: The best money puzzle I've found
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several different puzzle boxes and cubes for when I gift money to my kids. This one is my favorite! At first glance, it looks like nothing moves. It definitely takes a little fiddling to figure out what to do, and my 14-year-old definitely enjoyed solving it. The box is well made and can be put back together to use again. We all had fun trying to figure it out after he did!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking box, simple solution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put cash inside as a gift for a sixteen year old. It was sovled rather quickly. It requires about five steps to solve. You just pull on all the parts until you find a part that moves and repeat this until you have it opened. It is a nicely made box and it looks good, just simple solution.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: Not a product I would buy again !
customer_reviews.text: Very poorly made . Smaller then even a dollar bill size . Directions are not helpful and even with you tube videos to try to open box still will not . I would NOT recommend this to anyone .
customer_reviews.author: karyn

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to solve
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very well made, reusable Cons: Too easy to solve (4 moves) My thoughts: I gave this to my wife on Christmas with some things inside. I was hoping it would take her 5-10 minutes to solve. Nope! She had this thing open in less than a minute and she doesn't even do puzzles.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great Price...works just as promised
customer_reviews.text: I think the quality of this box for the price is a good match. The box could be easily destroyed by rough handling, but if you and/or your victim / participant are into solving the puzzle, it will work just fine. If they go all "Mongo Break Box" on you, it will probably be crushed. But if they respect that it is a puzzle that doesn't need to be forced to work it should be fine. Would buy again. Compartment inside is big enough for gift cards, cash, small items. I would say anything smaller diameter than a 50 cent piece and no taller than 3/4" will fit just fine.
customer_reviews.author: HeavyLunchTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: I used this as the holder to give a cash Christmas gift. It took a 20 year old about 25 minutes to get it solved. Other adults tried as well, but couldn't get it. She had a good time.
customer_reviews.author: MyGrnEyesF

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough to hold paper money without folding it.
customer_reviews.text: The box seemed to be shellacked shut initially and took us way to long to pry open. That wasn’t the end of the world though. My main gripe is that it’s not even big enough to put a bill in without folding it. I guess it’s my fault for not reading the deminsions and measuring my money before purchasing. I wasn’t thrilled and don’t think this is worth the money (I paid $15).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Money Wasted.
customer_reviews.text: There is quite a gap in one corner of the puzzle. With this gap you can easily tell how to solve the puzzle. Money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: lightnup

customer_reviews.title: Better looking than the product photo and works well
customer_reviews.text: This box met my expectations. I was expecting a roughly finished and stained box judging from the product photo. However, this box is more evenly stained and even has a slight gloss from a light coating of varnish. Crude, but not ugly. The mechanism works smoothly. There are no sharp edges or wood splinters sticking out. It will certainly do the job of holding some cash or gift cards if that is your wish. Puzzle lovers will likely enjoy it on its own merits. I think it is a bit expensive for what it is but not really regretting the purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Just JimTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Easy peezy lemon squeezy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to give a cash gift. But i wanted to make my nephew work a little for the the cash. I tried it without view the indtructions and had it opened within a minute. Should be much easier to figure out than it already is as open it once and the key piece moves freely now. So instead of giving up the cash that easy, I put a note inside with "SUCKER" written on it and that his mom and dad are holding his cash.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Blues

customer_reviews.title: Charming Looking for Nostalgic Gift
customer_reviews.text: Went to a 20's Graduation Party. Everyone was dressed in the flapper era. Our host was only 17 but classy brainy type. Thought he would like a little challenge instead of us just handing him the cash. He loved it, even made a point of sending us a thankyou note for it. The $50 in it probably didn't hurt either.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal

customer_reviews.title: Not Difficult
customer_reviews.text: This is not a difficult puzzle at all. I purchased 8 of these for money gift giving at Christmas thinking they would be hard to open. Not the case. They are very easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, good design, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, good design, poor quality. The wood is very soft and fragile.
customer_reviews.author: M. Condon

customer_reviews.title: If you like puzzle boxes, get this one for sure.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 similarly priced puzzle boxes from Amazon. I expected this one to be the worst but it was the best. Solid wood design, still looks intact and seamless even after several puzzle solves. Finish and craftsmanship is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ruperti

customer_reviews.title: A cute way to give a gift
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my dad who loves puzzles with a starbucks giftcard inside. He's so into puzzles that he didn't have too much difficulty getting in, but I think it would take a normal person a little longer. Plus, it's now regiftable if he wants, or he can hide things in it from people like me who struggle a bit more with puzzles. Be aware that it comes with the solution, so if the goal is for the recipient to figure it out on their own, make sure to remove the instructions!
customer_reviews.author: kitty

customer_reviews.title: Great puzzle. Try it yourself before gifting.
customer_reviews.text: Our 14 year old son loved this! We placed money for his school promotion inside. He and his brother, who got a different design, are now asking for a new challenge every promotion/birthday/holiday. This is the start of a fun family tradition. Note: Please check that it works before gifting. He struggled a little to long before we realized there was an issue. There was a part that wasn’t sliding as it should due to lacquer sealing it. We were able to take it to another room and break the seal without giving it away to him how the puzzle works. Otherwise, it is a fun, challenging gift.
customer_reviews.author: Alphamom

customer_reviews.title: This was fun
customer_reviews.text: My nephew is at the stage where he wants cash for gifts he can buy. I'm always looking for a way to make that a little more fun. It took him an hour or so and we all had fun with him as he tried to get inside. He wanted the instructions. I told him he had them, inside the box. LOL This is very well made. It took me, an expert puzzle solver a little bit to figure it out. The cuts in the wood are so precise you can't see them.
customer_reviews.author: WilGeno

customer_reviews.title: Broke after first use.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from my video, a piece loosened immediately. The dimension are too small to fit a dollar flat inside. Would not reccomend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cleary

customer_reviews.title: not a very good product
customer_reviews.text: took less than 2 minutes for the box to be opened by a young adult, certainly not worth the money..
customer_reviews.author: William P.

customer_reviews.title: Good Puzzle, must break it for it to work
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good puzzle box version for as inexpensive as it is. That being said you have to break the seal on the fake wood stain that they use to cover the balsa wood pieces. The box is inoperable until you find a way to crack the seal which can also make the opening bits more easy to see. It's obvious the item is painted as one complete set instead of individual pieces that are then assembled, but it's a pretty cheap box so you can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: Dbl0Chick

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I must not have read the dimensions accurately. It was quite small and definitely not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Felt sturdy at first, really wished it worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: First time I opened to stash cash, everything felt tight, and very well built. I did not force any pieces, and took great care in opening it. However, closing it up a second time after adding more cash, prior to wrapping it; I noticed the box was loose, the edges on the corner separated, you're distinctly able to tell where to start the puzzle, and the lid rattled. I was excited to give this as a gift and watch the cogs in their minds reel as they attempted to figure it out. Now I'm just disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher smith

customer_reviews.title: It was to easy for my 11 and 13 year old.
customer_reviews.text: Damn it if my kids didn’t figure it out in 2 min. Took me a day! Anyways, a good puzzle box to put money or gift card in. My biggest complaint is that the box is very cheap. It chips and splinters very easily. Wish it was made of something just a tad bit more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Higgs

customer_reviews.title: To easy to solve
customer_reviews.text: The box looked good and was well made. However both my husband and I were able open the box in less the a minute, and took my 8 year old about 3 mins. Was hoping it would be a little more difficult to open.
customer_reviews.author: kat1585

customer_reviews.title: Cool Cash Box
customer_reviews.text: Multiple steps to open so it’s difficult enough not to be “easy.” Grandson will like. He’s old enough to want cash for Christmas, but will need to work a little while for it. Solid construction compared to many. Good purchase. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: BSS

customer_reviews.title: Escape room
customer_reviews.text: I used this box to hide a key that I was hiding for an “escape room” for my math class. Technically it wasn’t an escape room, but more like a solve all of these puzzles to open the box with a homework pass inside. This held one of the many keys. The kids did figure it out but it took them a while.
customer_reviews.author: hbruchie

customer_reviews.title: Now it works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: The interior support piece was broken and the pegs were to short to make this a puzzle. You could just slip the piece out and open the box. I reinforced the interior piece with gorilla glue and a piece of 2x4 and drilled out the core of the wooden dowel pegs and reinforced them with nails. Now it works like a charm. I would have returned it if I had time but it was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Cool But Simple
customer_reviews.text: I store Costco gas receipts in it. It is not hard to figure out. Took me less than 2 minutes to completely open it the first time and that was only because I was being gingerly with it since I did not know how fragile it is. It is not a hard puzzle but it is cool nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Li

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality, too easily to solve. For children 8 and under.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to solve. Recommended for children 8 and under. The quality was terrible! Wouldn’t purchase again and it was so poorly made I didn’t even use it as a gift. Just threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for gift cards and people who like trinkets
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect! I get my sister in law for secret Santa every year and I just have to mess with her. This year I took it easy on her and hid some gift cards and cash in this simple puzzle box! It didnt take her long to open it and she likes to put her tarot cards in it now so it wasn't just a one use item which I'm really happy about, fun little gift for kids or someone you want to inconvenience for a bit!
customer_reviews.author: That one dude from that place the other day

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for Christmas gifts. One had a broken piece which ruined the whole point of being a puzzle because it showed how to get the box open. Don’t waist your money.
customer_reviews.author: N2DIY

customer_reviews.title: This product made Christmas fun again
customer_reviews.text: My two teenagers (15 and 18) only said they "wanted cash" this Christmas, but that didn't mean I couldn't make it more interesting. By putting their cash in these really cool boxes (and offering another $20 to whomever got it opened first WITHOUT using a hammer), it entertained us for the better part of an hour. They really enjoyed the challenge, and gave them something to "open" on Christmas morning, which we enjoyed.
customer_reviews.author: JB in Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Too Easy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy for a 13 year old girl. Nice box, but if you want it to be difficult then I would recommend something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Initially, the box was sealed shut and couldn't be opened. We had to use a knife to cut the finish that had sealed the pieces together. Once the moving pieces were actually moveable, the pegs were to small to hold the side in. It was easily just removed, without having to complete the other steps that would actually make it a puzzle box. I bought two other puzzle boxes that worked as advertised. This one was a waste of money, poor quality!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Poole

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my teenage sisters to give them cash, they both solved it in less than 30 seconds. Definitely took the fun out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy! Quality product, but I do not understand all these comments that say this is hard to open. Literally takes 15 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Fun little challenge for a kid
customer_reviews.text: Got it to hide a gift card. Good size for it. My 7 year old was able to open it after a few minutes of fiddling with it. Not too challenging but she enjoys being able to hide some little goodies inside. I'm a little worried it may not last very long. One panel has a joint that seems a little flimsy. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: coffee drinker

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These boxes have to be handles carefully as they seem a little fragile but for my purposes as a gift wrap they were great. I’m using them to gift cash to the grandkids. Be aware they are neither as long or as wide as a bill so money has to be rolled or folded into quarters.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Anne Karcher

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift box
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for putting in a gift card for our grandkids last Christmas. Took a few minutes for them to figure it out. Only issue I had was that it wouldn't fit thru the slot so we had to figure it out to open it first. Overall, it worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: scorpio1952

customer_reviews.title: Busted
customer_reviews.text: It looks amazing. We were excited to watch our daughter work really hard for the $ inside. She accidentally banged it on something and it came right open. She was happy about that, but it sorta lost the luster of the idea.
customer_reviews.author: McFlutters

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH FUN!
customer_reviews.text: Given to 14 year old grandson. The whole family got involved before solving. Takes a bit of time to figure out. Not easy but is solvable in time. So much fun! Of course there was money inside for his bday. Good quality! Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Way too easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gift for my husband who loves puzzel boxes and I was absolutely disappointed when he figured it out in 5secs.... Then my 5 year old son figured it out in 7 seconds, no exaggeration. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Ian R.

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this gift! I gave it to my boyfriend for Valentine’s Day and he had fun with it. It’s not overly complicated but it’s not super easy to solve initially. It’s very small about 3.5 inches wide and 6 inches long so if you plan to put anything inside of it (that isn’t money) just make sure it’s tiny. Nonetheless loved it, good condition, was fun! Hoping Bits and Pieces makes more puzzle boxes like this one. Looking to give one to my best friend next month as well :)
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun way to give cash. I was looking for a different way to give my son cash as a gift. It was fun watching him try to open the box. I finally had to give him the directions to get it open. He is usually someone who can figure out these type of devices so i thought he would figure it out pretty quickly. I have to say it was kind of funny watching him trying to figure out how it opened.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Fun gift idea!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves puzzles like this one, so I put a few small notes and some cash inside for one of his Christmas gifts. He was able to figure it out pretty quickly, but he enjoyed the challenge! I definitely recommend this as a fun addition to a gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Olson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: The box does not work. One end was glued shut and that end piece on the lid does not pop up.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Too easy
customer_reviews.text: Reviews stated this was difficult. Not the case. My nephew had it figured out within a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: ginag429

customer_reviews.title: Don’t put cash in until you test it SEVERAL times
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t open - money stuck inside - returned. Amazon said they didn’t receive the return. Hmmmmm.... not happy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Redd

customer_reviews.title: Mid twenty somethings were able to open the box in ...
customer_reviews.text: Mid twenty somethings were able to open the box in less than 3 minutes. If you are looking for one of those teaser gifts where the person receiving the gift actually has to put some time and effort to open their puzzle this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: methylamine

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to give money and gift cards!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 8 different puzzle boxes to pass out money and gift cards to the kids and grandkids this year. This one turned out to be very nice, just enough room for some cash and a gift card. Challenging enough to open but not too hard.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Well made puzzle box
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my dad with his gift card in it for Christmas. Was fun to watch him open it. Cool puzzle box that’s an easy fun way to give a gift so they may store things and such throughout the years
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: Kids had a blast trying to get to the money on Christmas Day. Great idea to make giving cash fun
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Ager

customer_reviews.title: Good fun
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a clever 8yr old boy with 2 brother's after his piggy bank broke. He loves to stash and collect things. The secret nature of this personal treasure chest thrilled him. He has had it for nearly 3 months and it has held up so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ty Green

customer_reviews.title: Stump the Kids! It’s great!
customer_reviews.text: We stashed a gold coin in these boxes as Christmas gifts for our grandkids. They loved having to solve the mystery of opening the box to get their treasure. Funny thing though- they liked the boxes better than the gold!
customer_reviews.author: A.M.Z.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool Toy. Not very difficult.
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot, but got into it in seconds. To be fair, I do a lot of puzzles and thinks like this. Construction seemed pretty sturdy and sold. If you want to do something similar on iPhone/iPad (not sure about Android), play The Room.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gravely

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas gift!
customer_reviews.text: These puzzle boxes were Christmas gifts for two friends. I put a gift card inside. We had a Christmas lunch at a restaurant and they spent more time figuring out how to open the box than they did eating.
customer_reviews.author: Jil Pennington

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Puzzle Box
customer_reviews.text: This puzzle box is neither clever nor well-made. The mechanism for opening it is very simple, and due to poor construction, this mechanism could easily be bypassed so that it was no longer a "puzzle" box at all - just a regular box. Very disappointed and would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: elena

customer_reviews.title: Great puzzle!
customer_reviews.text: This was a good puzzle. It has many steps to open. Was worth the expressions on my granddaughters face! Good thing she is a patient & determined person. And now she has a little treasure box to keep a few treasures in!
customer_reviews.author: Lilestmad

customer_reviews.title: Open very carefully-soft wood
customer_reviews.text: The top piece that you are supposed to lift up broke on the first try opening. I was taking care to do it gently but the wood is very soft. Still works even though it broke tough.
customer_reviews.author: Cedey Casabella

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ITEM FOR YOUNG CHILDREN
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for grandson, he added it to his collection of puzzles.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So cool!
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to watch my son try to open this! I hid gift cards in it but I had to use the instructions, very cleverly hidden opening. He'll love having the box to put things in after he figures out how to get the gift cards out.
customer_reviews.author: N Lynn

customer_reviews.title: reliable and honest
customer_reviews.text: arrived on date promised. One piece broke while getting it apart but was able to super glue it back together. It is a bit of a challenge to get it apart. We will see how the grand kids do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: We used this for our white elephant gift exchange. It was a hit. The puzzle was the perfect level of difficulty for the time we had. It's was too hard to figure out right away, but it was solved eventually with a little help.
customer_reviews.author: MeganKreu

customer_reviews.title: Great puzzle
customer_reviews.text: Great puzzle box! Love the fact that you can reuse it.......just the right amount of challenge
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This product is a really fun way to give a gift card or cash
customer_reviews.text: This product is a really fun way to give a gift card or cash. My boyfriend loves puzzles so I got him a gift certificate to go to an escape room and put it in here for Christmas. I had the instructions and could not even open it LOL. He had it open in about 5-8 minutes. The only thing I didn't like was when I tried to open it in before gifting it my nails easily scratched the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Jess R

customer_reviews.title: To Simple
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old had it open in under 3 minutes. Not what we expected based on the advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Reemts

customer_reviews.title: Fun item
customer_reviews.text: Kids loved having to solve a puzzle to get their gift.
customer_reviews.author: Debra H

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Really simple puzzle box great for kids. Me and my dad actually use the concepts from this box and made it into a nightstand on our YouTube channel. It turned out to be a really cool piece of puzzle furniture!
customer_reviews.author: Secret Stash Bros Builds

customer_reviews.title: Solved quickly
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice way to give a gift card however it took less than ten minutes for it to be opened. Thought it would be a little more difficult. The person I gave it to did like it though
customer_reviews.author: britch01

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Box
customer_reviews.text: Very nice puzzle box we are putting in our 1st grade grandson’s first grade final project, which is a time capsule to be opened when he graduates from high school. Going to put money and a note from us.
customer_reviews.author: DonnaD

customer_reviews.title: Short lived gift
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea but poor quality materials. Broke within a day.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Doll

customer_reviews.title: Had to check directions first time
customer_reviews.text: It was fun now it is passed on to someone else who opened it to share with another group
customer_reviews.author: Ken zagata

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but fairly easy
customer_reviews.text: This box is interesting. The puzzle was easy to solve, but still fun. Quality is acceptable. Probably best for a kid around 10 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Like this a lot
customer_reviews.text: Loved this! It took us quite a while to figure out. Took the grandson less than 30 minutes but he loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: It's ok, basic, much smaller than I imagined. Great for gift card or money but not as a stand alone piece
customer_reviews.author: lard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and vuild quality
customer_reviews.text: I put a $20 in it and gave the wooden box without the instructions to my nephew. Took him awhile to figure how to open it, when he did he got the cash surprise.
customer_reviews.author: username hidden

customer_reviews.title: It's time to use a little  brain power.
customer_reviews.text: I put a folded twenty dollar bill in the box, took out the instructions and wrapped it up for my 15 year old grandson's birthday gift. He enjoyed figuring it out. My 13 old granddaughter wanted one too. She tried to open it for two weeks before I gave her the instructions. Now she has a box to pass on for a gift if she wants.
customer_reviews.author: Rogues21

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and easy to assemble and disassemble once you figure out how. I used it as an x-mas gift.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these this past Christmas as everybody seems to want gift cards. We had them open several different versions simultaneously and had a few minutes of fun. They were relatively easy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C

customer_reviews.title: Not a fun gift
customer_reviews.text: A bit cheese. Got all my grandkids these and they had them open in less than 5 minutes. After you get them open then you can see the lines wher they open so really you cant regift them. Not a fun gift
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: This was a wonderful gift for my nephew who needed to have a place to keep his treasures safe. Also because it's a puzzle it made it even better as he loves puzzles.
customer_reviews.author: sjisland

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this! The first joint was a little stuck to start -- felt like I might break it when I followed the directions. Once I worked it up and down a few times it was perfect. Of everyone who tried it some gave up and another got it in 20 seconds! The intended recipient took about 5 minutes to figure it out, which was perfect!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stasi

customer_reviews.title: It’s good I guess
customer_reviews.text: This box is a great gift, although it does feel cheap. I gave this as a graduation gift with cash inside. It only took him about ten minutes to open.. I was hoping it would be harder to get into. The box is sturdy but made with cheap materials. I don’t think it would break unless treated roughly
customer_reviews.author: Lion

customer_reviews.title: Love this for gifts
customer_reviews.text: Great for all ages. Put a gift card or cash inside
customer_reviews.author: AKjos

customer_reviews.title: A Small Challenge
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend asked for a digital copy of a game for Christmas, so I printed it and stick it inside this box. Box is well made, took him about 5 or so minutes to figure it out. This one is not difficult to solve at all for an adult, would be good for people who want money/gift cards/ digital codes to make the gift not so "boring" for the giver.
customer_reviews.author: Shurnevia Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful to use to give money as a gift rather than in a card!
customer_reviews.text: Loved these boxes. Gave my 7 Grandchildren money in these boxes for Christmas. They loved them. They had so much fun! Much better than money in a card. They all kept them to keep things. We got to be the fun Grandparents!
customer_reviews.author: Jean A Windmiller

customer_reviews.title: Fairly challenging and decently made for price. Rustic not finely finished
customer_reviews.text: Box was purchased for Christmas gift for teenager. Comes with directions. I actually had to use the direction to put it back together after placing gift inside. It was a nice challenge. Decently made for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pam R

customer_reviews.title: Very neat little gift holder!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my brother for Christmas as he wanted a gift card but I wanted to make it a little more memorable. It did take him and a couple other family members quite a while to figure it out, but he did in less than an hour. Either way he thought it was really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make a gift card gift more interesting. This just arrived today and I am very pleasantly surprised! This will definitely do the job!
customer_reviews.author: Yana

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to open
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and is good quality. However, it is way too easy to open. Bought for a white elephant Christmas gift and the person that got my gift had no trouble at all opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A fun and unique way to give cash or gift certificates!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to give gift certificates and cash as gifts. It’s a fun puzzle! It’s fun to watch the recipient figure it out! The solution is included so you can get it open. It’s definitely a unique way to give a gift!
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

product_meta.title: Bits and Pieces - Stash Your Cash - Secret Puzzle Box Brainteaser - Wooden Secret Compartment Brain Game for Adults
feature_bullets: Slide your coins and bills through the two slots on either side of this clever box, then look for the challenging solution to opening it.
Made of pine wood, finished in a rich walnut stain.
A great gift for people who love brainteasers and trick puzzles.
